results.deck: Without Warning, published by Capcom.
results.name: Without Warning

results.deck: Summoner 2 is a fantasy-RPG where you take the role of Maia, a queen and goddess reborn, as you try to save the world from impending doom.
results.name: Summoner 2

results.deck: Predator: concrete jungle is a 3rd person action/adventure. In the game you play as a predator who is disgraced because humans have stolen his technology and you must hunt them down and regain your gear and honor .
results.name: Predator: Concrete Jungle

results.deck: Pirate Francis Blade searches for the treasure of the Black Buccaneer.
results.name: Pirates: Legend of the Black Buccaneer

results.deck: The final game in the Fatal Fury franchise, Garou is set ten years after the death of Geese Howard, and features eleven brand new characters for the player to take control over.
results.name: Garou: Mark of the Wolves

results.deck: A spiritual successor to the Ghosts N' Goblins games, Maximo is an extremely challenging 3-D action platformer.
results.name: Maximo: Ghosts to Glory

results.deck: A sequel to the original Bubble Bobble title from Taito, featuring the now human Bub and Bob. It incorporated the use of Rainbows as both a weapon to defeat enemies and as a platform to climb the levels.
results.name: Rainbow Islands

results.deck: James Sunderland tries to locate his wife in the eponymous town of Silent Hill in the first sequel to the 1999 PlayStation horror game. It is the first installment of the Silent Hill series on the PlayStation 2.
results.name: Silent Hill 2

results.deck: The sequel to NanaOn-Sha's PlayStation game Vib Ribbon, Vib Ripple once again places you in the role of Vibri as she searches for hidden artifacts inside seemingly ordinary-looking photographs.
results.name: Vib Ripple

results.deck: Only ever released in Germany, SingStar Die Toten Hosen was the first title in the series dedicated to one single artist.
results.name: SingStar: Die Toten Hosen

results.deck: Madden NFL 2002 was the first game to feature the expansion team, The Houston Texans and Daunte Culpepper was the player on the cover of the game.
results.name: Madden NFL 2002

results.deck: Based on a cartoon on Nickelodeon, Avatar: The Last Airbender is an action game that puts you in the role of Aang, a young and powerful airbender. Console Version was developed by THQ Studio Australia.
results.name: Avatar: The Last Airbender

results.deck: Ruroni Kenshin: Enjou! Kyoto Rinne is a 3D fighting game based off the Ruroni Kenshin series which was released exclusively for the PlayStation 2 system
results.name: Rurouni Kenshin: Enjou! Kyoto Rinne

results.deck: Freedom Fighters is an alternate history squad-based shooter from IO Interactive, critically hailed for its simple yet deep squad mechanics.
results.name: Freedom Fighters

results.deck: Buzz! is a trivia game that puts the player in a fictional game show .
results.name: Buzz!: The Mega Quiz

results.deck: Join Winnie the Pooh and his friends for a splendiferous bithday party in the Hundred Acre Wood!
results.name: Disney's Winnie the Pooh's Rumbly Tumbly Adventure

results.deck: This is the second game based on the 2003 TMNT series.
results.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 2: Battle Nexus

results.deck: A game based on the small toy cars.
results.name: Hot Wheels: Stunt Track Challenge

results.deck: Splashdown is a racing game for the Xbox and Playstation 2
results.name: Splashdown

results.deck: Jump and trick your way down mountains in Freak Out: Extreme Freeride
results.name: Freak Out: Extreme Freeride

results.deck: A unique mix of Disney and Square Enix characters join spiky-haired hero Sora on his epic journey to save multiple worlds from the evil of the Heartless and find his lost friends Riku and Kairi.
results.name: Kingdom Hearts

results.deck: A game that continues the story of the movie of the same name.
results.name: Ghost Rider

results.deck: Street Fighter EX3 is the third, and final, installment in the Street Fighter EX series.
results.name: Street Fighter EX3

results.deck: Hitman: Blood Money is a 3rd person action-adventure game released by Eidos in 2006. The game is a continuation of the popular Hitman franchise in which the player takes control of the mysterious assassin, Agent 47.
results.name: Hitman: Blood Money

results.deck: The game that popularized 3D arcade racing and kick-started the 3D revolution of the 90's. Released in 1992 for arcades, it was later ported to Sega home consoles.
results.name: Virtua Racing

results.deck: Kessen was a launch title for the Japanese version of the PlayStation 2. The first real-time strategy game for the PS2.
results.name: Kessen

results.deck: The second expansion in the Final Fantasy XI Online series.
results.name: Final Fantasy XI Online: Chains of Promathia

results.deck: EA Sports brings its NASCAR series to the Seventh Generation gaming consoles with NASCAR 08.
results.name: NASCAR 08

results.deck: Super Returns is an open world tie-in to the film. It features story missions based on saving the city of Metropolis, and 80 square miles of free roaming goodness. Also, the final boss battle is a tornado.
results.name: Superman Returns

results.deck: Shaman King Power of Spirit is a Fighter/Strategy game hybrid for the PS2, based on the shaman king anime/manga.
results.name: Shaman King: Power of Spirit

results.deck: Fire ProWrestling Returns is a wrestling game for wrestling enthusiasts in a series that has spanned many sequels.
results.name: Fire Pro Wrestling Returns

results.deck: Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis is a game that allows you to build and manage your own dino-themed park. Building upon basic simulation/tycoon games Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis offers unique innovations that help it define and attach itself to the well known movie franchise.
results.name: Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis

results.deck: Xenosaga Episode II: Jenseits von Gut und Böse expands on the story of Jr. and his relationship with his brothers Albedo and Gaignun.  It also introduces Shion's brother, Jin Uzuki, as a playable character.
results.name: Xenosaga: Episode II - Jenseits von Gut und Böse

results.deck: This family friendly game combines Lego Star Wars, and Lego Star Wars: The Original Trilogy, into one adventure spanning the entire Star Wars universe.
results.name: LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga

results.deck: Join over 500,000 people from across the globe in the world of Vana'diel for your very own Final Fantasy adventure in the series' first foray into the MMORPG genre.
results.name: Final Fantasy XI Online

results.deck: A PlayStation 2 launch title, X-Squad is about a team of four soldiers that come together after W-Squad has been defeated and Dr. Bianca Noble kidnapped. Ash, X-Squad's leader, insists on saving her and her stolen experiment Project Medusa.
results.name: X Squad

results.deck: Activision's open world adventure game puts you in the role of an undercover Los Angeles Cop.
results.name: True Crime: Streets of LA

results.deck: The third entry in Humongous Entertainment's cartoonish baseball series is the first to hit consoles, bringing with it a revised roster of MLB players as well as the original kids.
results.name: Backyard Baseball

results.deck: Secret Weapons Over Normandy is a flight simulation game set in World War II, in which players take control of James Chase, an American pilot. The game features American, British, Soviet, Japanese and German aircraft.  (A TIE Fighter and X-wing are also unlockable)
results.name: Secret Weapons Over Normandy

results.deck: The sequel to Gungrave. Experience a high-octane action/shooter/brawler where you can choose between the wrathful blind swordsman Juji Kabane, the relentless rock star Rocketbilly Redcadillac or the undead hero Beyond the Grave.
results.name: Gungrave: Overdose

results.deck: Star Trek: Voyager - Elite Force puts the player in the role of Lt. Munro, a member of the Hazard Team tasked with getting Voyager out of a mysterious "isodimensional rift" trapping it and preventing it from returning to Earth.
results.name: Star Trek: Voyager - Elite Force

results.deck: Sequel to KAO the Kangaroo on the Dreamcast, Kao the Kangaroo Round 2 features familiar 3D platforming, charming visuals and soundtrack
results.name: Kao the Kangaroo Round 2
SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.22: Advanced Daisenryaku - Deutch Dengeki Sakusen

results.deck: Released in 2002 for Xbox and Playstation 2, Blood Omen 2 answered many questions about Kain's rise to power while asking a few new ones.
results.name: Legacy of Kain: Blood Omen 2

results.deck: The first Final Fantasy game for the PlayStation 2 brought a new cinematic quality to the series with voice acting and fully 3D environments. The story follows Tidus, a young man transported one thousand years into the future to find a world quite unlike his own.
results.name: Final Fantasy X

results.deck: Kaan: Barbarian's Blade is an action-adventure game.
results.name: Kaan: Barbarian's Blade

results.deck: Fifteen years after the events of Suikoden II, the stories of Hugo (the son of a village chief), Chris (the virtuous Knight of Zexen), and Geddoe (the rebellious unit commander) intertwine as they gather the 108 Stars of Destiny.
results.name: Suikoden III

results.deck: Formula One 2002 was the second Formula 1 game to be developed by SCEE Liverpool Studio which was released in late 2002.
results.name: Formula One 2002

results.deck: Stuntman is a game for the PS2 and GBA and is centered around the player starting a career as a Hollywood stunt man.
results.name: Stuntman

results.deck: Mace Griffin Bounty Hunter is a futuristic sci-fi shooter that follows in the footsteps of previous futuristic sci-fi shooters.
results.name: Mace Griffin: Bounty Hunter

results.deck: London Racer: World Challenge is a racing game in which drivers race tracks all over the world.
results.name: London Racer: World Challenge

results.deck: A turn-based modern military tactics game released for the Xbox in 2004 and in the US in early 2005. It was later released for PS2 and PSP.
results.name: Dai Senryaku VII: Modern Military Tactics

results.deck: God of War II continues the story of Kratos as he wields his newly-bestowed god-like powers, much to the dismay and fear of the other gods.
results.name: God of War II

results.deck: Asterix & Obelix XXL 2: Mission: Las Vegum takes the cultural references and self-referential themes of the comics and applies them to video games. Dozens of familiar franchises, characters, sights and sounds appear as players explore Julius Caesar's Las Vegum resort. See it for yourself before the copyright lawyers do!
results.name: Astérix & Obélix XXL 2: Mission: Las Vegum

results.deck: An invading army attacks the isolated town of Ciel, and four young heroes team up to find out why.
results.name: Wild Arms 4

results.deck: Blood Will Tell is an action game that borrows themes from a Japanese manga called Dororo, created by Osamu Tezuka. Its main protagonist is a young samurai, Hyakkimaru who is on a quest to recover his 48 body parts from the fiends that haunt feudal Japan.
results.name: Blood Will Tell: Tezuka Osamu's Dororo

results.deck: The sequel to 4x4 Evolution, 4x4 Evo 2 is an offroad racing game developed by Terminal Reality
results.name: 4x4 Evo 2

results.deck: Zone of the Enders is a fast-paced action game in which you play as Leo Stenbuck, the reluctant pilot of the orbital frame Jehuty.  With Jehuty you must protect the Jupiter space colony known as Antilla from an invading force known as Bahram.
results.name: Zone of the Enders
SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.20: Space Harrier 2 - Space Harrier Complete Collection

results.deck: Sega Ages: Hokuto no Ken (or Fist of the North Star) is a remake of the sega Megadrive/Genesis game Hokuto no Ken: Shinseiki Ura Kyuusei Aruji Densetsu (also known as Last Battle) for the Playstation 2.
results.name: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.11: Hokuto no Ken

results.deck: Fu'un Super Combo is a compilation disc that includes both Savage Reign and Kizuna Encounter, together. Only released in Japan.
results.name: Fu'un Super Combo

results.deck: Vexx is a 3D platformer developed by Acclaim's Austin Studio (formerly Iguana Entertainment). The design borrowed liberally from open-world platformers like Super Mario 64, but with tough competition from new franchises Rachet & Clank and Jak & Daxter, Vexx had a difficult time making a blip on the radar.
results.name: Vexx

results.deck: 2002's version of EA's annual basketball franchise.  Steve Francis of the Houston Rockets was the cover athlete.
results.name: NBA Live 2002

results.deck: It's a baseball game!
results.name: High Heat Major League Baseball 2004

results.deck: Graffiti Kingdom is an Action-RPG in which the player can draw his own characters to defeat the many creatures in the game.
results.name: Graffiti Kingdom

results.deck: Scaler is a platformer released in 2004 for all three major consoles. Published by Take-Two Interactive.
results.name: Scaler

results.deck: F1 2002 was the second last Formula 1 game released by EA before losing the official license to Sony Computer Entertainment. It featured drivers, tracks and races from the 2002 Formula 1 World Championship. The game also featured an advance telemetry feature that allowed users to view race infomation.
results.name: F1 2002

results.deck: The last Final Fantasy game released on the PS2, Final Fantasy XII is distinguished by its condition-driven "gambit" battle system, its Monster Hunter-like open environments and side quests, and its setting in the existing fictional universe of Ivalice.
results.name: Final Fantasy XII

results.deck: Smuggler's Run 2: Hostile Territory is the sequel to Smugglers Run, You play as an unseen character working as a smuggler in Georgia trying to deliver illegal goods to destinations within 3 extensive maps
results.name: Smuggler's Run 2: Hostile Territory

results.deck:
Circus Maximus: Chariot Wars is a chariot racing game set in ancient Rome.

Each chariot is manned by both a driver and a fighter. The player must control the steering of the driver and also cross chariot combat with the fighter. The driver and fighter can be controlled individually in co-op.
results.name: Circus Maximus: Chariot Wars

results.deck: Jade Cocoon 2 is the PS2 sequel to the original on the PS1. Collect and raise monsters to battle alongside you, the player, in the hopes of stopping the Kalma invasion.
results.name: Jade Cocoon 2

results.deck: A very early PlaySation 2 title, Orphen: Scion of Sorcery is an action-RPG based on an anime called "Sorcerous Stabber Orphen." The Japanese title for the game is the same as the anime.
results.name: Orphen: Scion of Sorcery

results.deck: More redneck truckers! More roadkill! More skinheads! More mullets! Big Mutha Truckers is back in the form of Big Mutha Truckers 2: Truck Me Harder, a driving/racing game developed by Eutechnyx.
results.name: Big Mutha Truckers 2: Truck Me Harder

results.deck: Explore a seemingly abandoned lunar space station in this unique first-person adventure game.
results.name: Echo Night: Beyond

results.deck: Ready 2 Rumble Boxing: Round 2 is a boxing video game developed and published by Midway, it is the sequel to Ready 2 Rumble Boxing.
results.name: Ready 2 Rumble Boxing: Round 2

results.deck: Ape Escape 2 is the PlayStation 2 sequel to 1999's critically acclaimed Ape Escape. It is an action platformer developed by SCEI that places the player in the shoes of Jimmy, who has to stop an army of monkeys once again led by Specter from taking over the world.
results.name: Ape Escape 2

results.deck: Tak and Lok are the representatives for the Pupanunu tribe in the Great Juju Challenge. It's up to the player to guide these two heroes through the 15 trials in order to win the blessing of the Moon Juju.
results.name: Tak: The Great Juju Challenge

results.deck: The four heroes of the Conflict: Desert Storm games return in this strategic third-person action game. This time the missions take place all over the world across a variety of terrain with a fictional counter-terrorism setting.
results.name: Conflict: Global Terror

results.deck: Follow Mace Windu, Obi-Wan, and Anakin, as the fight through the early battles of the clone wars against Count Dooku and his ancient weapon "The Dark Reaper".
results.name: Star Wars: The Clone Wars

results.deck: Be Bill Rizer and kick ass through a variety of intense levels by yourself or with a friend.
results.name: Contra: Shattered Soldier

results.deck: Phenom is the second game in Midway's NBA Ballers series.
results.name: NBA Ballers: Phenom

results.deck: The premiere dancing game franchise returns in this new edition, featuring online multiplayer and the most songs yet.
results.name: Dance Dance Revolution SuperNOVA

results.deck: NHL 06 is the first NHL game to be released after the NHL Lockout of 2005.  It features a slight graphical upgrade.  This is the last NHL game on the GameCube.
results.name: NHL 06

results.deck:
Tales of Rebirth is the sixth main entry of Namco's Tales series of video games. 
Tales of Rebirth is set in a world where humans (called Humas) and Gajumas (beast people) coexist in relative peace.Rebirth breaks slightly from the series with a new take on the Linear Motion Battle System, the so-called "Three-Line Linear Motion" system. The player's characters and enemies are placed on three different planes and the player has the ability to switch between these planes during battle.
results.name: Tales of Rebirth
SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.6: Puzzle & Action + Bonanza Bros.

results.deck: A specially upgraded version of the first Oneechanbara, trying to hide its embarrassingly juvenile premise behind a more generic title.
results.name: Zombie Hunters

results.deck: Set years before the World Warrior tournament of Street Fighter II, Street Fighter Alpha explores the backstories of some of the series's familiar faces (while introducing new ones) with a revamped fighting game engine (complete with a new cartoony art style).
results.name: Street Fighter Alpha: Warriors' Dreams

results.deck: Squaresoft's first PS2 release, The Bouncer is a beat'em up that features RPG mechanics and a branching story path. It tells the tale of three bouncers that fight to rescue a girl from the clutches of a megalomaniacal CEO. The game was known for its production values, introducing a juggling physics engine and graphical techniques such as bloom lighting and depth-of-field effects.
results.name: The Bouncer

results.deck: The third entry in the Soul series, and being the first to release on all major home consoles. SC II was also the first in the series to introduce exclusive cameos from other franchises.
results.name: Soulcalibur II
